title: Steemit: Under New Management - Complete History of STEEM and the TRON Takeover
author: punicwax / Van Kush Family
overview: Comprehensive history of cryptocurrency from Silk Road to Steemit, the TRON takeover, the HIVE fork, and how the platform works under new management

hive_fork.what_happened: New STEEM currency and blockchain created from before Justin owned it

new_rules.second_payout: 30 days if new votes after 7 days

quiz_questions.q: What was Bitcoin's price when @punicwax first discovered it?
quiz_questions.explanation: Discovered via Silk Road → Google → Bitcointalk.org

quiz_questions.q: What is Steemit's underlying blockchain technology?
quiz_questions.a: Graphene Blockchain - created by Dan and Ned, also used by Bitshares and IBM's OpenLedger Fabric
quiz_questions.explanation: Any website could use Graphene to have Witnesses, Nodes, Currency, and Voting

quiz_questions.q: What does 'Delegated Proof of Stake' mean?
quiz_questions.a: Delegated = Voting; Proof of Work = Mining (only voted-for Witnesses mine); Staking = Interest on holdings
quiz_questions.explanation: Combination of voting, mining, and interest systems

quiz_questions.q: What is HIVE and why does it exist?
quiz_questions.a: Fork of Steemit created by Witnesses after Justin Sun bought Steemit INC - now two parallel platforms
quiz_questions.explanation: Witnesses forked when war broke out over control of the platform

quiz_questions.q: What changed from Steemit Beta to the new rules?
quiz_questions.a: Payout went from 24 hours to 7 days (+ 30 day second payout), multiple daily posts divide earnings, added follow feature
quiz_questions.explanation: Original rules didn't give posts enough time to collect views and earnings
